wikipedia_page.main: Flight Lieutenant Godfrey Bremridge  (1 March 1895 – 12 September 1941) was a World War I flying ace who was credited with five victories.

response: Bremridge was born in 1925 in Transvaal, in what was then the Union of South Africa to British parents (his father was Godfrey Bremridge) on an orange farm, but left in 1933 for Britain where he grew up.
* Godfrey Bremridge, First World War flying ace
